availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
James F. Robinson,
GOVERNOR OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
TO ALL WHO SHALL SEE THESE PRESENTS, GREETING:

WHEREAS, judgment has been rendered by the Franklin Cir Ct for $2603 65/100 Principal and $520 73/100 in Damages -- against A. J Banta Sheriff of Nicholas Co as damages for failure to pay in the revenue of sd Co -- for the year 1861 as required by law AND WHEREAS, It appears from satisfactory evidence that the case of the said presents strong considerations for the interposition and indulgence of the Executive:

Now, Know Ye, That in consideration of the premises, and by virtue of the power vested in me by the Constitution, I have thought proper to REMIT, and do, by these presents, remit said judgment Damages of $520 73/100 aforesaid -- and do hereby forever acquit, release, and discharge the said from the same, enjoining all officers to respect this REMISSION, and govern themselves accordingly.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at FRANKFORT, the day of , in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and , and in the year of the Commonwealth.

BY THE GOVERNOR:
, SECRETARY OF STATE.
Commmonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.
